blog.name: a-cleanlook
blog.title: My Celeb Crushes
blog.description: All my favorites in one place. 58,000 followers 🦈 Hollywood, VS Angels, K-Pop Idols and more. Please keep any comments about the ladies respectful. None of the posts are mine in any legal sense as this is just a collection of my favorite pictures and GIFs from around the web.

blog.name: princessaryathevaliant
blog.title: Princess Arya the Valiant
blog.description: A devoted fan defending her precious cinnamon roll, its all you need to know!...and i love cheesecake...bye. Currently on hiatus.

blog.name: tabbytabbytabby
blog.title: Downloading New Emotion
blog.description:
Tabitha. Bisexual. She/Her. 30 years young. Stressed out nursing student. I have 3 kitties named Arthur, Doctor and Jasper. My biggest interest right now is Game of Thrones. I am definitely a multi-shipper and writer. Though my main ships are Braime and Gendrya. Sansa Stark deserves the world. I'm also fully invested in Teen Wolf and 9-1-1. Specifically Derek Hale, Theo Raeken, Stiles Stilinski, Lydia Martin, and Buddie
Currently reading: Queen of Air and Darkness by Cassandra Clare
Currently binging: Star Trek: Discovery
Currently taking fic prompts for: Most of my Teen Wolf and All American ships (and characters) and Buddie. And other fandoms. I'm open
And aesthetic prompts for: Teen Wolf, All American, or my other fandoms.
And also taking prompts from this list this listthis list
and this list
And my Bad Things Happen Bingo Card
As well as this list of mini fic prompts
(please specify which list when sending prompts ♥) My AO3Thiam Discord Ashivia Discord
Upcoming Events I'm Participating In (Or Plan To):
- Hurt/Comfort Exchange (Now - May 24th)
- Thiam Disney Movie Fest (June 17-24th)
- Fandom Trumps Hate (Posting deadline: December 31st)

summary:
Jaqen H'ghar: My ambitions are as cold as iron.
Jaqen H'ghar:*kisses Arya's hair softly* But my heart is not.
body:
Jaqen H'ghar: My ambitions are as cold as iron.
Jaqen H'ghar:*kisses Arya's hair softly* But my heart is not.

tags: A Song of Ice and Fire
summary: Day Four Gendry tells Arya about the holidays in Flea Bottom.[[MORE]] The pair was crowded around a fire lit in Arya’s chambers....
caption:
Day Four

Gendry tells Arya about the holidays in Flea Bottom.

The pair was crowded around a fire lit in Arya’s chambers. Gendry couldn’t help but imagine the words many of the men would whisper if they were caught. He could imagine the Hound would say something crude, but worst of all he could imagine Jon wanting to whip him through the streets in Wintertown if he discovered that Gendry was spending time with Arya in her bedchamber after dark. Oh Gods, when you put it that way it sounded even more boorish than it was.

Right now the two of them were huddled together, shoulder to shoulder, searching for warmth from each others bodies. The Others had been defeated, but the seemingly never-ending freezing temperatures got worse than before. The Citadel claimed it to be one of the worst winters in the history of Westeros. The deathly cold was not the only thing left to worry about since the Great War ended. To no-one’s surprise Cersei Lannister still posed a threat to the south. Jaime Lannister had told them about his sister’s plan when he finally made it north. He mentioned that he could not compromise his honour for his sister’s plotting. Tyrion had been overjoyed to see his brother come to his senses after all these years. No one was surprised to hear of Yuron Greyjoy sailing to retrieve the Iron Fleet from Bravos, Daenerys mentioned something about him needing to work on his lying. Gendry hated to admit it, but to him going south didn’t seem like such an awful idea. Yes the war against Cersei would be dangerous, but the warmer weather of the south seemed like a relief compared to the bone-chilling weather of the north. He never thought he would say it, but Gendry was starting to miss his home in Flea Bottom. He knew he was crazy for thinking that way, since the Starks had given him so much more in a short period of time than he had ever gotten while living in Flea Bottom, but he wondered how his old shop was doing, if someone had bought it, or if one of the other men took over after he left.

“What are you thinking about?” Arya asked, lifting her head off of Gendry’s shoulder. “You have that stupid look on your face.”

Gendry rolled his eyes. “I was thinking about Flea Bottom.”

“You’ve never talked about it much, why now?” Arya looked at him skeptically, that analyzing look crossing her hardened features.

“I guess I miss it. I know it sounds ridiculous, but it was where I spent my childhood. I have so many memories there, and the holiday celebrations are approaching. The festivities there are just so much different than how you northerners celebrate.”

“I never spent the holidays there. Joffrey’s little show cut my family’s stay short. The only one that got to spend any sort of holiday down there was Sansa and even she didn’t really get to celebrate anything.” Arya started, “I’d listen if you wanted to talk about it though. Maybe you can add a different perspective on Kings Landing, one I have never been able to see because of the trauma my family suffered there.”

“Are you sure? I don’t want to bring back any memories.” Arya nodded her head and rested it back on his shoulder. Her arm came up to wrap around his bicep as she snuggled closer to the heat his body was radiating. “Our festivities always start at the same time as the Festival of the Mother. They are a whole week affair. It’s so big because it’s usually the only time of year we get food from the royal family. Of course, it isn’t much food, but it’s still more than we get the rest of the year. Usually it’s leftover meat and bread, but sometimes we got fruit and vegetables as well. It was a time when we could be thankful for what we had. To be thankful we weren’t going to starve that year.

“Since no one had any money, we would make things for our family members or those we loved out of stones and sticks. Nothing extravagant, but it would be meaningful. It was the thought and effort that mattered when you had to extra coin to spend. I never had any family to celebrate with, so I would spend the week with Tobho Mott and his daughters. His wife had died in the birthing bed after delivering their second daughter. I was positive that if he hadn’t of sent me to the wall I would have married his eldest daughter. She was the same age as me, maybe a year my senior, but she was pretty. She wanted to work for Lord Baelish and make more money for her family, but he would never let any of his children work in a whorehouse. Instead, they worked at the bakery. I think one of them actually knew Hot Pie. I never wanted to marry one of his daughters, but I thought I owed him for mentoring me in the smithy. I would have done it had he asked. He was truly the only family I had.” Gendry lowered his head into his hands, it had pained him so when on his return to Kings Landing he heard of what came of Tobho Mott. His old mentor slain.

“Do you ever wonder what your life would have been like if you had known your father was King Robert?” Arya was looking at him with curiosity now. Her grey eyes boring into his own with pure astonishment.

“I’ve thought about it before. Wondered if my life would have been like Jon’s, treated as better than a piece of shite that littered the streets of Flea Bottom. But when I think about it, I don’t think Cersei would ever let me be seen at court. I would always be a disgrace to her name. Lord Tywin certainly would never have allowed it, and I don’t know if my father would ever want to fight to have me around. I certainly wasn’t his only bastard. I heard he had hundreds scattered around Westeros. Now look at us. I’m the only Baratheon alive, and I’m only half. Jon mentioned legitimizing me after all of the snow settled and Cersei was dealt with. He knows I pose no threat to the throne, he know I don’t want it. Queen Daenerys has second thoughts on the matter, but deep down she knows that I don’t desire it either. I don’t feel like I truly deserve the title Baratheon. I never knew my father, and I only ever met my Uncle Stannis once. All he wanted was to use me for my King’s blood. I don’t feel like a Baratheon. But since house Baratheon stemmed from House Targaryen they don’t want to see it wiped from existence. So here I am there last resort. Getting offered something every bastard dreams of, and I don’t even really want it.”

“You do deserve it. You helped fight for the Seven Kingdoms just as much as Jon or Daenerys or any of us for that matter. Just because you never met your father doesn’t make you any less of his son. Jon never met his mother, but he loves her just the same. My mother and I never saw eye-to-eye but I still love and miss her everyday. Bran is the three-eyed raven now and doesn’t act a smidge of his old self, but he is still a Stark. You’re just as much a Baratheon as Jon is a Stark. Never doubt your worth or how deserving you are.” Arya was standing in front of him now. Both of her hands rested on his shoulders. He was sitting down but she met his eye-level evenly. He looked up at her, his bright blue eyes sparkling as the light of the fire danced across them. Arya’s hand moved to the back of Gendry’s head and moved it to rest against the flat of her stomach. She rubbed small circles on the back of his scalp with her fingers. He brought both of his hands to rest on her hips, he pulled her closer. Breathing in the scent of her. He was overwhelmed by the smell of forest and snow. As he pulled away from her, Gendry left his hands resting on her hips.

“Words can’t tell you how happy I am that you’re alive. There wasn’t a day that went by that I didn’t think of you.” He whispered, just loud enough for her to hear. A small and appreciative smile pulled on the corner of her lips.

“I missed you too Gendry.” Arya muttered, pressing her lips to the top of his head. Gendry wished they could stay in this moment forever, but he knew he would have to leave soon; they were already at risk of getting caught. He stood slowly and looked down at the woman he shared some of the hardest moments of his life with and squeezed her hips slightly before pulling her into his arms tightly. “Maybe after all of this settles down we can spend the holidays together and celebrate like you used too.”

“I’d really like that Arry. I really would.” Gendry bent down and pressed a small kiss to her forehead before moving to make his way to the door. “I’ll see you in the morning, sleep well.”

“Goodnight Gendry.”

   “Goodnight Arya.”
caption_abstract:
Day Four

Gendry tells Arya about the holidays in Flea Bottom.

Gendry tells Arya about the holidays in Flea Bottom.

The pair was crowded around a fire lit in Arya’s chambers. Gendry couldn’t help but imagine the words many of the men would whisper if they were caught. He could imagine the Hound would say something crude, but worst of all he could imagine Jon wanting to whip him through the streets in Wintertown if he discovered that Gendry was spending time with Arya in her bedchamber after dark. Oh Gods, when you put it that way it sounded even more boorish than it was.

Right now the two of them were huddled together, shoulder to shoulder, searching for warmth from each others bodies. The Others had been defeated, but the seemingly never-ending freezing temperatures got worse than before. The Citadel claimed it to be one of the worst winters in the history of Westeros. The deathly cold was not the only thing left to worry about since the Great War ended. To no-one’s surprise Cersei Lannister still posed a threat to the south. Jaime Lannister had told them about his sister’s plan when he finally made it north. He mentioned that he could not compromise his honour for his sister’s plotting. Tyrion had been overjoyed to see his brother come to his senses after all these years. No one was surprised to hear of Yuron Greyjoy sailing to retrieve the Iron Fleet from Bravos, Daenerys mentioned something about him needing to work on his lying. Gendry hated to admit it, but to him going south didn’t seem like such an awful idea. Yes the war against Cersei would be dangerous, but the warmer weather of the south seemed like a relief compared to the bone-chilling weather of the north. He never thought he would say it, but Gendry was starting to miss his home in Flea Bottom. He knew he was crazy for thinking that way, since the Starks had given him so much more in a short period of time than he had ever gotten while living in Flea Bottom, but he wondered how his old shop was doing, if someone had bought it, or if one of the other men took over after he left.

“What are you thinking about?” Arya asked, lifting her head off of Gendry’s shoulder. “You have that stupid look on your face.”

Gendry rolled his eyes. “I was thinking about Flea Bottom.”

“You’ve never talked about it much, why now?” Arya looked at him skeptically, that analyzing look crossing her hardened features.

“I guess I miss it. I know it sounds ridiculous, but it was where I spent my childhood. I have so many memories there, and the holiday celebrations are approaching. The festivities there are just so much different than how you northerners celebrate.”

“I never spent the holidays there. Joffrey’s little show cut my family’s stay short. The only one that got to spend any sort of holiday down there was Sansa and even she didn’t really get to celebrate anything.” Arya started, “I’d listen if you wanted to talk about it though. Maybe you can add a different perspective on Kings Landing, one I have never been able to see because of the trauma my family suffered there.”

“Are you sure? I don’t want to bring back any memories.” Arya nodded her head and rested it back on his shoulder. Her arm came up to wrap around his bicep as she snuggled closer to the heat his body was radiating. “Our festivities always start at the same time as the Festival of the Mother. They are a whole week affair. It’s so big because it’s usually the only time of year we get food from the royal family. Of course, it isn’t much food, but it’s still more than we get the rest of the year. Usually it’s leftover meat and bread, but sometimes we got fruit and vegetables as well. It was a time when we could be thankful for what we had. To be thankful we weren’t going to starve that year.

“Since no one had any money, we would make things for our family members or those we loved out of stones and sticks. Nothing extravagant, but it would be meaningful. It was the thought and effort that mattered when you had to extra coin to spend. I never had any family to celebrate with, so I would spend the week with Tobho Mott and his daughters. His wife had died in the birthing bed after delivering their second daughter. I was positive that if he hadn’t of sent me to the wall I would have married his eldest daughter. She was the same age as me, maybe a year my senior, but she was pretty. She wanted to work for Lord Baelish and make more money for her family, but he would never let any of his children work in a whorehouse. Instead, they worked at the bakery. I think one of them actually knew Hot Pie. I never wanted to marry one of his daughters, but I thought I owed him for mentoring me in the smithy. I would have done it had he asked. He was truly the only family I had.” Gendry lowered his head into his hands, it had pained him so when on his return to Kings Landing he heard of what came of Tobho Mott. His old mentor slain.

“Do you ever wonder what your life would have been like if you had known your father was King Robert?” Arya was looking at him with curiosity now. Her grey eyes boring into his own with pure astonishment.

“I’ve thought about it before. Wondered if my life would have been like Jon’s, treated as better than a piece of shite that littered the streets of Flea Bottom. But when I think about it, I don’t think Cersei would ever let me be seen at court. I would always be a disgrace to her name. Lord Tywin certainly would never have allowed it, and I don’t know if my father would ever want to fight to have me around. I certainly wasn’t his only bastard. I heard he had hundreds scattered around Westeros. Now look at us. I’m the only Baratheon alive, and I’m only half. Jon mentioned legitimizing me after all of the snow settled and Cersei was dealt with. He knows I pose no threat to the throne, he know I don’t want it. Queen Daenerys has second thoughts on the matter, but deep down she knows that I don’t desire it either. I don’t feel like I truly deserve the title Baratheon. I never knew my father, and I only ever met my Uncle Stannis once. All he wanted was to use me for my King’s blood. I don’t feel like a Baratheon. But since house Baratheon stemmed from House Targaryen they don’t want to see it wiped from existence. So here I am there last resort. Getting offered something every bastard dreams of, and I don’t even really want it.”

“You do deserve it. You helped fight for the Seven Kingdoms just as much as Jon or Daenerys or any of us for that matter. Just because you never met your father doesn’t make you any less of his son. Jon never met his mother, but he loves her just the same. My mother and I never saw eye-to-eye but I still love and miss her everyday. Bran is the three-eyed raven now and doesn’t act a smidge of his old self, but he is still a Stark. You’re just as much a Baratheon as Jon is a Stark. Never doubt your worth or how deserving you are.” Arya was standing in front of him now. Both of her hands rested on his shoulders. He was sitting down but she met his eye-level evenly. He looked up at her, his bright blue eyes sparkling as the light of the fire danced across them. Arya’s hand moved to the back of Gendry’s head and moved it to rest against the flat of her stomach. She rubbed small circles on the back of his scalp with her fingers. He brought both of his hands to rest on her hips, he pulled her closer. Breathing in the scent of her. He was overwhelmed by the smell of forest and snow. As he pulled away from her, Gendry left his hands resting on her hips.

“Words can’t tell you how happy I am that you’re alive. There wasn’t a day that went by that I didn’t think of you.” He whispered, just loud enough for her to hear. A small and appreciative smile pulled on the corner of her lips.

“I missed you too Gendry.” Arya muttered, pressing her lips to the top of his head. Gendry wished they could stay in this moment forever, but he knew he would have to leave soon; they were already at risk of getting caught. He stood slowly and looked down at the woman he shared some of the hardest moments of his life with and squeezed her hips slightly before pulling her into his arms tightly. “Maybe after all of this settles down we can spend the holidays together and celebrate like you used too.”

“I’d really like that Arry. I really would.” Gendry bent down and pressed a small kiss to her forehead before moving to make his way to the door. “I’ll see you in the morning, sleep well.”

“Goodnight Gendry.”

   “Goodnight Arya.”
trail.content_abstract:
Day Four

Gendry tells Arya about the holidays in Flea Bottom.

blog.name: warsofasoiaf
blog.title: Wars and Politics of Ice and Fire
blog.description: A blog dedicated to political, military and historical analysis of A Song of Ice and Fire

summary: Do you think Arya Stark could follow in the footsteps of her mentor Syrio and become the First Sword of Bravos? I think it could...
question: Do you think Arya Stark could follow in the footsteps of her mentor Syrio and become the First Sword of Bravos? I think it could be fitting for her, to achieve this on her own terms without adhering to what others have desired for her in the past. I think it's something that she would be very suited for, given the many skills she has learned in her time in Bravos.
answer:
No, I think being the First Sword would require her to spend a lot of time in Braavos, honing her skills, getting noticed by the Braavosi power structure, and then acting as First Sword. I think she’s going to go back to Westeros before she would have the opportunity to be the First Sword.

Thanks for the question, Anon.

SomethingLikeALawyer, Hand of the King

reblog.comment:

tags: also like you usually wear a dress under ceremonial armor so...?
summary: Any chance that when Sansa and Arya meet again, Sansa will be in armor (ceremonial of course) and Arya in a dress? They could...
question: Any chance that when Sansa and Arya meet again, Sansa will be in armor (ceremonial of course) and Arya in a dress? They could both be like "Wut?"
answer: Sure, there’s a chance? Many things are possible, and this one is not that unlikely compared to some. But it’s not like Arya has ever expressed a wish for armor, nor did she ever express a dislike of dresses within Sansa’s hearing. (Arya has spoken about disliking gowns because you can’t fight in a fancy gown, and she dislikes wearing girls’ clothes in the Riverlands, but in Braavos she wears a long tunic and as Mercy she wears a dress and doesn’t ever blink about it.) So there’s not really much irony here, so I don’t really see the point, sorry.

reblog.comment: Sure, there’s a chance? Many things are possible, and this one is not that unlikely compared to some. So there’s not really much irony here, so I don’t really see the point, sorry.

So there’s not really much irony here, so I don’t really see the point, sorry.

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: I think that my ideal endgame for Sansa and Arya’s book reunion is them learning to accept the differences in each other, and...
body: I think that my ideal endgame for Sansa and Arya’s book reunion is them learning to accept the differences in each other, and their varying interests. Sansa doesn’t have to learn to use a sword and Arya doesn’t have to learn to embroider, but they both recognize that that is what the other enjoys, and each has its uses.

reblog.comment: I think that my ideal endgame for Sansa and Arya’s book reunion is them learning to accept the differences in each other, and their varying interests. Sansa doesn’t have to learn to use a sword and Arya doesn’t have to learn to embroider, but they both recognize that that is what the other enjoys, and each has its uses.

Sansa doesn’t have to learn to use a sword and Arya doesn’t have to learn to embroider, but they both recognize that that is what the other enjoys, and each has its uses.

Sansa doesn’t have to learn to use a sword and Arya doesn’t have to learn to embroider, but they both recognize that that is what the other enjoys, and each has its uses.

blog.name: madasahatter666
blog.title: The Fangirl Life
blog.description: Proud to be a wand waving, magic using, games winning, lightsaber wielding, time travelling, bone examining, ring wearing, deducing Divergent Shadowhunter AKA a fangirl

body:
Penpals

I am wanting to get back into writing to pen pals so if anyone is interested let me know.

I am 22yo female from England and I love Disney (basically anything disney) Harry potter, shadowhunters (love Malec), The fast franchise,the originals and TVD (Klaus is my baby) the flarrow verse is great I really love the Lengends and would die for Sara Lance. I love Lord of the rings and as a typical brit i love Doctor Who, Merlin and Sherlock. Of course we cannot forger supernatural. I really like the Percy Jackson series and I love George RR Martin and Game of Thrones (Brienne and Arya are my murder babies and nothing can stop that). I also have a big love of Greek mythology (partly why I love PJ so much I think) I also have a weird thing for Hades. Also The Rock gotta love The Rock. I have a huge love of marvel and I think imma die in April when Endgame is released. I also really love Kdramas and some Kpop and I am still not over Moon Lovers.

Let me know if you’re interested.
